return_description: A UnicodeDecodingResult instance, representing the next Unicode scalar, an indication of an error, or an indication that the UTF sequence has been fully decoded.

params.param_description: An iterator of code units to be decoded. input must be the same iterator instance in repeated calls to this method. Do not advance the iterator or any copies of the iterator outside this method.

Methods.method_description: Starts or continues decoding a UTF-8 sequence.
Methods.method_declar: mutating func decode<I>(_ input: inout I) -> UnicodeDecodingResult where I : IteratorProtocol, I.Element == Unicode.UTF8.CodeUnit
static func decode(_ source: Unicode.UTF8.EncodedScalar) -> Unicode.Scalar
static func encode(_ source: Unicode.Scalar) -> Unicode.UTF8.EncodedScalar?

params.param_description: The Unicode scalar value to encode.
A closure that processes one code unit argument at a time.

Methods.method_description: Encodes a Unicode scalar as a series of code units by calling the given closure on each code unit.
Methods.method_declar: static func encode(_ input: Unicode.Scalar, into processCodeUnit: (Unicode.UTF8.CodeUnit) -> Void)

return_description: true if byte is a continuation byte; otherwise, false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified code unit is a UTF-8 continuation byte.
Methods.method_declar: static func isContinuation(_ byte: Unicode.UTF8.CodeUnit) -> Bool
static func transcode<FromEncoding>(_ content: FromEncoding.EncodedScalar, from _: FromEncoding.Type) -> Unicode.UTF8.EncodedScalar? where FromEncoding : _UnicodeEncoding
